name: preferentially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows someone or something is preferred to others: Job applicants with the best qualifications and experience are treated preferentially. Small businesses were considered preferentially for government contracts.
in a way that is more likely than something else: There are several theories as to why this form of flu preferentially killed young adults. See
preferential
More examplesFewer examplesMany farmers believe people will preferentially choose foods produced locally.After review, the court determined that that no one had been treated preferentially.Female pandas respond preferentially toward males that perform acrobatic handstands. The disorder is preferentially found in females.They begin to shed light on why the virus preferentially grows in the gut.
